title: How to Filter Fry Oil for Reuse

steps.title: When you are done frying for the day, scoop out any large chunks that are left in the oil.
steps.content: When you are done frying for the day, scoop out any large chunks that are left in the oil. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the oil to cool to 150 - 170 째F, 65 - 75 째C.
steps.content: Allow the oil to cool to 150 - 170 째F, 65 - 75 째C. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place a coffee filter or a cheesecloth in the mason jar and roll the edge of the filter over the lip of the jar.
steps.content: Place a coffee filter or a cheesecloth in the mason jar and roll the edge of the filter over the lip of the jar.

steps.title: Loosely install just the ring and make snug to secure the paper coffee filter or cheesecloth.
steps.content: Loosely install just the ring and make snug to secure the paper coffee filter or cheesecloth.

steps.title: Pour the warm oil into the filter through the hole in the ring being careful not to overfill the filter.
steps.content: Pour the warm oil into the filter through the hole in the ring being careful not to overfill the filter. It will take a few minutes for the oil to pass through. Caution, the oil is still hot enough to cause a burn. [3] X Research source

steps.title: When the oil has run through the filter, carefully remove the ring and filter.
steps.content: When the oil has run through the filter, carefully remove the ring and filter. Discard the filter, place the lid on the jar and secure with the ring.

steps.title: Store your oil for your next cooking adventure, be it deep frying, stir frying, pan seasoning or just lubricant duty.
steps.content: Store your oil for your next cooking adventure, be it deep frying, stir frying, pan seasoning or just lubricant duty. [4] X Research source
